html.p: Defender ATP / Microsoft 365 Defender ATP - This dashboard shows Defender ATP alerts.
Data Collection: It uses Microsoft 365 Defender Add-on for Splunk for Microsoft Defender ATP data collection.

search.query: `cs_o365_defender_atp_alerts` | head 1 | stats count | eval label="`cs_o365_defender_atp_alerts`" | eval data=if(count>0, "Data Present", "Data Not Present") | table label, data

`cs_o365_defender_atp_alerts` computerDnsName=$tkn_host|s$ | stats count, latest(_time) as _time, last(firstEventTime) as firstEventTime, last(lastEventTime) as lastEventTime, last(lastUpdateTime) as lastUpdateTime, last(resolvedTime) as resolvedTime, last(severity) as severity, last(status) as status, last(threatFamilyName) as threatFamilyName, last(threatName) as threatName, last(title) as title, last(investigationState) as investigationState, last(detectionSource) as detectionSource, last(assignedTo) as assignedTo, last(category) as category, last(classification) as classification, last(description) as description, last(incidentId) as incidentId, last(investigationId) as investigationId by detectorId, id, machineId, computerDnsName | eval firstEventTime=strftime(strptime(firstEventTime, "%FT%T.%7QZ"), "%F %T"), lastEventTime=strftime(strptime(lastEventTime, "%FT%T.%7QZ"), "%F %T"), lastUpdateTime=strftime(strptime(lastUpdateTime, "%FT%T.%7QZ"), "%F %T"), resolvedTime=strftime(strptime(resolvedTime, "%FT%T.%7QZ"), "%F %T") | table computerDnsName, count, firstEventTime, lastUpdateTime, resolvedTime, incidentId, title, threatFamilyName, threatName, category, classification, severity, status, investigationId, invenstigationState, assignedTo, detectionSource, detectorId, id, machineId

html.p: Drilldown to see evidence for the incidents.

search.query: `cs_o365_defender_atp_alerts` computerDnsName=$drilldown_computerDnsName|s$ detectorId=$drilldown_detectorId|s$ id=$drilldown_id|s$ machineId=$drilldown_machineId|s$ | head 1 | spath path=evidence{} output=evidence | mvexpand evidence | rename evidence as _raw
